item.title: Ticket #524 (Edit template doesn't recognise different Blog address URI) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: You're seeing this with 1.3? This was fixed long ago in 1.3. Go to Manage->Files and select "Main Template" or ".htaccess" Both of those should be picked up in the blog address directory.

item.title: Ticket #494 (PHP in Static Pages) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Might be worth including one of the plugins with WP or rolling it into core. Setting up a "contact" page or "archives" page is a fairly common thing, and right now you have to go hunting for a plugin.

item.title: Ticket #525 (inserting image map html goes very badly) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
Do you happen to have the setting "WordPress should correct invalidly nested XHTML automatically" set? If so, you're likely experiencing bugs related to the tag balancer, reported here:

​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/bug_view_page.php?bug_id=0000053

I previously provided a patch in that bug report that you can try.

item.title: Ticket #525 (inserting image map html goes very badly) updated
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description:
I forgot to mention that this is what I advise my content writing folk:

If you use an image mapper, please (1) close the area tags, and (2) put all of the HTML generated on one line. If you dont do these two things, it can get pretty ugly.

item.title: Ticket #525 (inserting image map html goes very badly) created
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description: any program that spits out image map html does a bad job, that's true. however, wordpress does more harm than good when trying to fix bad code. For an example, see the text file I'm attaching. Basically, wp messes up the html worse, and also deletes some text if there is a paragraph below.

item.title: Ticket #524 (Edit template doesn't recognise different Blog address URI) updated
item.dc:creator: snowgoon
item.description: Logged by snowgoon - forgot to login when I logged it!

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated
item.dc:creator: kopa
item.description:
The site seems to function ok (when I replace SCRIPT_NAME with PHP_SELF as advised), but there are no more custom 404 pages then. I tried to debug this by inserting debug code in index.php and it gives a fatal error on undefined is_404() function:

PATH INFO : /wordpress/index.php ERROR: REQUEST_URI: /wordpress/ is_404(): Fatal error: Call to undefined function: is_404()

The code was:

echo "PATH INFO : {$_SERVERPATH_INFO?}\n"; echo "ERROR: {$_GETerror?} \n"; echo "REQUEST_URI: {$_SERVERREQUEST_URI?} \n"; echo "is_404(): "; echo is_404() ? "true" : "false" ; echo " \n"; echo "is_single(): "; echo is_single() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_page(): "; echo is_page() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_archive(): "; echo is_archive() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_date(): "; echo is_date() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_year(): "; echo is_year() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_month(): "; echo is_month() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_day(): "; echo is_day() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_time(): "; echo is_time() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_author(): "; echo is_author() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_category(): "; echo is_category() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_search(): "; echo is_search() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_feed(): "; echo is_feed() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n"; echo "is_home(): "; echo is_home() ? "true" : "false"; echo " \n";

item.title: Ticket #521 (editing a post of a lower user overides ownership) updated
item.dc:creator: trbecker
item.description:
On Linux, on a copy of your local tree, run patch -p1 -d directory_of_the_copy < 521_post_ownership_override_fix.patch. You can reverse it by adding a -R after patch. And if you have a local CVS running, cvs commit should put it on your tree.

edited on: 12-06-04 10:17

item.title: Ticket #524 (Edit template doesn't recognise different Blog address URI) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
WordPress offers the ability to have a different URI for your Blog address than that of the WordPress URI. This works fine when posting entries.

However, if you choose to use this option, any changes made to the template are still made in the Wordpress URI rather than in the Blog address URI - which I would expect.

This means anytime I change the template, I need to manually move index.php from the WordPress URI to my Blog address URI.

Is this expected behaviour? It seems illogical to me to offer an option to have index.php located elsewhere but not to have the Template editor use that location.

item.title: Ticket #521 (editing a post of a lower user overides ownership) updated
item.dc:creator: bh
item.description: Trbecker, thanks for this patch. However, I had problems applying it. Can you let me know what command I should run (ie from CVS root directory?), and where to run it so I can test this patch.

item.title: Ticket #521 (editing a post of a lower user overides ownership) updated
item.dc:creator: trbecker
item.description: Killed. The patch renames the combo, and, on edit, alters the post owner in this order: combo, prior owner, user altering the post.

item.title: Ticket #508 (no 'theme' directory) updated
item.dc:creator: trbecker
item.description:
Attached a patch to fix it. Add a .keep file with the a string inside, so tar will not forget it when creating a tarball.

edited on: 12-06-04 01:21

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan

Try replacing SCRIPT_NAME with PHP_SELF in wp-blog-header.php. See this patch:

​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/file_download.php?file_id=141&type=bug

item.title: Ticket #523 (Mail headers don't get in to headers section - end up in message content.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Sorry about the line breaks in the code.

item.title: Ticket #523 (Mail headers don't get in to headers section - end up in message content.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The headers From, Content-Type, MIME-versions, Content-Transfer-Encoding appear within the body of the email and are not read as headers.

This occured for me in wp1.2 as well (see ​http://wordpress.org/support/3/11386#post-91054 )

It seems that extra lines are generated between headers. I changed functions.php starting at line 1125 by removing the carriage returns and keeping only the line breaks to get around this:

changed \r\n to \n $message_headers = "MIME-Version: 1.0\r\n" . "$from\r\n" . "Content-Type: text/plain; charset=\"" . get_settings('blog_ch arset') . "\"\r\n";

$message_headers = "MIME-Version: 1.0\n"

. "$from\n" . "Content-Type: text/plain; charset=\"" . get_settings('blog_ch

arset') . "\"\n";

Attached is a sample "bad" (original code) email and "good" (edited code) email. Irrelevant headers have been removed. Not that in the bad email, no extra line appears after the from field even though it too was followed by \r\n.

Note also the redundancy of the MIME-version and Content-Type headers.

(Where does the message get Base64'd? I couldn't find it - the headers added during this part of the process, however, seem to be well formatted).

item.title: Ticket #522 (admin cannot edit pages created by a lower user) updated
item.dc:creator: bh
item.description:
Sorry, copy and paste when a little crazy. Should just be:

A level 6 user has created some pages and are shown on the site, and in the backend in manages >> pages, and can be edited.

When logged in as admin and then click through to manage >> pages there are no pages shown in this section, even though they are on the front-end.

There is a bug preventing the admin from seeing pages created by other users.

item.title: Ticket #522 (admin cannot edit pages created by a lower user) created
item.dc:creator: bh
item.description:
WordPress Support » Beta Discussion

admin cannot edit pages created by a lower user

RSS feed for this thread

Anonymous Anonymous

A level 6 user has created some pages and are shown on the site, and in the backend in manages >> pages, and can be edited.

When logged in as admin and then click through to manage >> pages there are no pages shown in this section, even though they are on the front-end.

There is a bug preventing the admin from seeing pages created by other users.

item.title: Ticket #521 (editing a post of a lower user overides ownership) created
item.dc:creator: bh
item.description: When user level 6 edits a post from user level 5 the post changes to the editors ownership. I think this is a bug where the original author's ownership should be retained. Often an editor might do some copy editing on contributors work so the ownership should not get overwritten.
